title: Hurricane - Livestock Preparation Before the Storm

tasks.task: Reviewing herd health program and preparing for potential livestock relocation during hurricanes.
subtasks: Ensure unique animal identification such as hot brands, metal ear tags, or electronic tags.
Assemble emergency equipment and supplies, including feed, water, hand pumps, and generators.
Store feed and water in a secure, dry location to prevent spoilage.
Prioritize animals for evacuation based on potential risks (e.g., animals near calving/kidding).
Move livestock to higher ground or appropriate shelter in flood-prone areas.
Manage animal behavior to prevent injuries during storms.

tasks.task: Developing emergency plans for livestock relocation and disease prevention.
subtasks: Update health protocols and record-keeping systems.
Train farm staff on emergency procedures and animal identification.
Conduct regular inspections of farm infrastructure (e.g., fences, storage facilities) to prevent storm-related damages.
Develop procedures for safe animal transport and separation during relocations.
Secure emergency contact information for animal welfare organizations and veterinarians.

tasks.task: Enhancing farm preparedness for unexpected disasters.
subtasks: Retrofitting or reinforcing barns and pens to withstand strong winds and heavy rains.
Elevating outdoor structures or livestock waterers to avoid floodwaters.
Establishing a generator-powered backup system for critical facilities (e.g., veterinary clinics, testing labs).
Implementing a communication plan for farm staff during emergencies.
Creating a system for tracking and accounting for missing or separated livestock after disasters.
